Javier Charro MartÃƒÂ­nez was born in LeÃƒÂ³n in 1980 and moved to Las Palmas de Gran Canaria when he was but months old. His father, who had been a painter in his youth, passed on his enthusiasm for art to his son. Javier and his brother shared their hobby and spent hours painting influenced by fantastic art and American comics.

After collaborating in an animated short film in 2003, he starts publishing illustrations for role-playing games. From then on, he combines his career in architecture with his work as a freelance illustrator.

In 2006, he moves to Madrid where he works as a creative architect in the well-known Spanish studio A-cero while he continues with his career as an illustrator. In the summer 2010, he decides to concentrate on illustration, starting new projects and accepting more orders.
